title: Roman Font
content:
EYES WIDE font.  
sorry, but this is the bigger picture I could get, I hope you can help me.

[https://makeupandbeautyblog.files.wordpress.com/2007/03/laura-mercier-ey...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415203702/https:/makeupandbeautyblog.files.wordpress.com/2007/03/laura-mercier-eyes-wide-large.jpg "https://makeupandbeautyblog.files.wordpress.com/2007/03/laura-mercier-eyes-wide-large.jpg")
author: plax

comments.content:
Too small for me to say for certain. Perhaps there is information from Berard Associates, the firm that was responsible for Laura Mercier logo brand identity design / Berard Associates the [http://berardassociates.com/laura-mercier-color-line/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415203702/http:/berardassociates.com/laura-mercier-color-line/ "http://berardassociates.com/laura-mercier-color-line/")  
Don

As for the logotype for \_laura mercier\_, it looks like a modified version of neue Helvetica® Std 27 Ultra Light Condensed [http://www.fonts.com/font/adobe/neue-helvetica/27-ultra-light-condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415203702/http:/www.fonts.com/font/adobe/neue-helvetica/27-ultra-light-condensed "http://www.fonts.com/font/adobe/neue-helvetica/27-ultra-light-condensed"). Main difference is that \_a\_ has had is tail clipped. A classic example of logo-making 101 -- take a retail font, clip something from a letter and cash a big cheque.  
Don

RE: don... Thanks so much Don  
RE: fvilanakis... apparently is very close, thanks!
